The close season for coarse fishing gets underway on Monday.

urls.title: What to do in a flood - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
Flooding can happen at any time.

With 5.2 million homes and businesses at risk of flooding, it‚Äôs important to be aware of the small steps you can take now to be better prepared.

Know what to do in a flood üëâ https://t.co/yDrqZN037T https://t.co/XD1erHEm93

A Flood Alert has been issued by @EnvAgency: https://t.co/kWxNpAPYxr for high tides at Climping Seafront on 13th March. Please take care of yourself, family & neighbours, especially if vulnerable. See the WSCC website for advice on keeping safe & well: https://t.co/59ZHn12jY6 https://t.co/viwO2yayZE

Enjoy the last weekend of the #CoarseFishing season.
 #Severn reports of good catches #barbel to 11lb and #roach to 2lb around #Shrewsbury
Don‚Äôt forget your #RodLicence #GoFishing
 Close season starts Monday 15th March @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/QGe8AsYQfy

Carbon Week took place from 1 ‚Äì 5 March. Did you catch any of our webinars? 

If not, you can catch up with discussions about the #carbon cycle, carbon auditing, reducing #emissions and the opportunities around this here: https://t.co/cqBeJu0PXh #carbonweek @EnvAgency @DefraFAS https://t.co/3nReBuPlvu
Just got some pics of recent work completed by @CHC_Limited for @EnvAgencyNW. This one is overflow at #Croston dam as part of what‚Äôs required for #reservoir compliance. https://t.co/LLhIPacqeI
2nd eg of completed work by @CHC_Limited for @EnvAgencyNW is a strengthened wall alongside the river #Wyre #Lancashire https://t.co/eAwJI6l4UW

urls.title: Nurturing the next generation of women in science
urls.description: Today is International day of Women and Girls in Science. Unfortunately, we still need a special international day for this. Despite targeted efforts made over the past two decades to close the gap, women are still underrepresented in STEM (science, technology, engineering and maths). Those that have made it in are facing a stark gender pay gap, which in the UK is 50% greater than the national average for all employers. As well as this, 90% of funding for physical sciences and engineering goes to

tweets.text: @EmmaHowardBoyd @COP26 @EnvAgency @AdaptOurWorld We have a group of amazing female scientists on our team at @Earthwatch_Eur. Our head of science @TNoordwijk wrote a great blog about how we can nurture #WomenInSTEM. Perhaps you could give our voices a boost? https://t.co/1VhTymSnDa.
